elements.description:
The default element used for items in the vaadin-combo-box.

### Styling

The following shadow DOM parts are available for styling:

Part name | Description
---|---
`content` | The element that wraps the item label or template content

The following state attributes are exposed for styling:

Attribute    | Description | Part name
-------------|-------------|------------
`selected` | Set when the item is selected | :host
`focused` | Set when the item is focused | :host

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: index
properties.description: The index of the item

properties.name: item
properties.description: The item to render

properties.name: label
properties.description: The text label corresponding to the item

properties.name: selected
properties.description: True when item is selected

properties.name: focused
properties.description: True when item is focused

properties.name: _itemTemplateInstance
properties.description: The template instance corresponding to the item

properties.name: renderer
properties.description: Custom function for rendering the content of the `<vaadin-combo-box-item>` propagated from the combo box element.

properties.name: _oldRenderer
properties.description: Saved instance of a custom renderer function.

elements.description:
The overlay element.

### Styling

See [`<vaadin-overlay>` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html)
for `<vaadin-combo-box-overlay>` parts.

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: _last
properties.description: returns true if this is the last one in the opened overlays stack

properties.name: owner
properties.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `owner` The host element of the renderer function.
- `model` The object with the properties related with rendering.

properties.name: template
properties.description: The template of the overlay content.

properties.name: instanceProps
properties.description: Optional argument for `Polymer.Templatize.templatize`.

properties.name: content
properties.description: References the content container after the template is stamped.

properties.name: model
properties.description: Object with properties that is passed to `renderer` function

properties.name: modeless
properties.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description:
When set to true, the overlay is hidden. This also closes the overlay
immediately in case there is a closing animation in progress.

properties.name: focusTrap
properties.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

properties.name: restoreFocusOnClose
properties.description: Set to true to enable restoring of focus when overlay is closed.

methods.name: _outsideClickListener
methods.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

methods.name: render
methods.description: Manually invoke existing renderer.

elements.name: Vaadin.ComboBoxOverlayElement

attributes.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

attributes.description: The template of the overlay content.

attributes.description: Optional argument for `Polymer.Templatize.templatize`.

attributes.name: modeless
attributes.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description:
When set to true, the overlay is hidden. This also closes the overlay
immediately in case there is a closing animation in progress.

attributes.name: focus-trap
attributes.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-close
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-close
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-escape-press
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-escape-press
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed on ESC button press. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-open
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-open
fired after the `vaadin-overlay` is opened.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-outside-click
events.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

properties.description: The element to position/align the dropdown by.

properties.name: alignedAbove
properties.description: If `true`, overlay is aligned above the `positionTarget`

properties.name: theme
properties.description: Used to propagate the `theme` attribute from the host element.

methods.name: indexOfLabel
methods.description: Gets the index of the item with the provided label.

methods.name: __requestItemByIndex
methods.description:
If dataProvider is used, dispatch a request for the item’s index if
the item is a placeholder object.

methods.name: getItemLabel
methods.description: Gets the label string for the item based on the `_itemLabelPath`.

methods.name: _patchWheelOverScrolling
methods.description:
We want to prevent the kinetic scrolling energy from being transferred from the overlay contents over to the parent.
Further improvement ideas: after the contents have been scrolled to the top or bottom and scrolling has stopped, it could allow
scrolling the parent similarly to touch scrolling.

elements.description: `` is a combo box element combining a dropdown list with an input field for filtering the list of items. If you want to replace the default input field with a custom implementation, you should use the [``](#/elements/vaadin-combo-box-light) element. Items in the dropdown list must be provided as a list of `String` values. Defining the items is done using the `items` property, which can be assigned with data-binding, using an attribute or directly with the JavaScript property. ```html ``` ```js combobox.items = ['apple', 'orange', 'banana']; ``` When the selected `value` is changed, a `value-changed` event is triggered. This element can be used within an `iron-form`. ### Item rendering `` supports using custom renderer callback function for defining the content of ``. The renderer function provides `root`, `comboBox`, `model` arguments when applicable. Generate DOM content by using `model` object properties if needed, append it to the `root` element and control the state of the host element by accessing `comboBox`. Before generating new content, users are able to check if there is already content in `root` for reusing it. ```html ``` ```js const comboBox = document.querySelector('#combo-box'); comboBox.items = [{'label': 'Hydrogen', 'value': 'H'}]; comboBox.renderer = function(root, comboBox, model) { root.innerHTML = model.index + ': ' + model.item.label + ' ' + '' + model.item.value + ''; }; ``` Renderer is called on the opening of the combo-box and each time the related model is updated. DOM generated during the renderer call can be reused in the next renderer call and will be provided with the `root` argument. On first call it will be empty. ### Item Template Alternatively, the content of the `` can be populated by using custom item template provided in the light DOM: ```html ``` The following properties are available for item template bindings: Property name | Type | Description --------------|------|------------ `index`| Number | Index of the item in the `items` array `item` | String or Object | The item reference `selected` | Boolean | True when item is selected `focused` | Boolean | True when item is focused ### Lazy Loading with Function Data Provider In addition to assigning an array to the items property, you can alternatively provide the `` data through the [`dataProvider`](#/elements/vaadin-combo-box#property-dataProvider) function property. The `` calls this function lazily, only when it needs more data to be displayed. See the [`dataProvider`](#/elements/vaadin-combo-box#property-dataProvider) in the API reference below for the detailed data provider arguments description, and the “Lazy Loading“ example on “Basics” page in the demos. __Note that when using function data providers, the total number of items needs to be set manually. The total number of items can be returned in the second argument of the data provider callback:__ ```javascript comboBox.dataProvider = function(params, callback) { var url = 'https://api.example/data' + '?page=' + params.page + // the requested page index '&per_page=' + params.pageSize; // number of items on the page var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest(); xhr.onload = function() { var response = JSON.parse(xhr.responseText); callback( response.employees, // requested page of items response.totalSize // total number of items ); }; xhr.open('GET', url, true); xhr.send(); }; ``` ### Styling The following custom properties are available for styling: Custom property | Description | Default ----------------|-------------|------------- `--vaadin-combo-box-overlay-max-height` | Property that determines the max height of overlay | `65vh` The following shadow DOM parts are available for styling: Part name | Description ----------------|---------------- `text-field` | The text field `toggle-button` | The toggle button See [`` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html) for `` parts. See [`` documentation](https://vaadin.com/components/vaadin-text-field/html-api/elements/Vaadin.TextFieldElement) for the text field parts. The following state attributes are available for styling: Attribute | Description | Part name -------------|-------------|------------ `opened` | Set when the combo box dropdown is open | :host `disabled` | Set to a disabled combo box | :host `readonly` | Set to a read only combo box | :host `has-value` | Set when the element has a value | :host `invalid` | Set when the element is invalid | :host `focused` | Set when the element is focused | :host `focus-ring` | Set when the element is keyboard focused | :host `loading` | Set when new items are expected | :host In addition to `` itself, the following internal components are themable: - `` - `` - `` Note: the `theme` attribute value set on `` is propagated to the internal themable components listed above. See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: focusElement
properties.description: Focusable element used by vaadin-control-state-mixin

properties.name: _previousTabIndex
properties.description: Stores the previous value of tabindex attribute of the disabled element

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Set to true to disable this input.

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: Number of items fetched at a time from the dataprovider.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Total number of items.

properties.name: dataProvider
properties.description:
Function that provides items lazily. Receives arguments `params`, `callback`

`params.page` Requested page index

`params.pageSize` Current page size

`params.filter` Currently applied filter

`callback(items, size)` Callback function with arguments:
  - `items` Current page of items
  - `size` Total number of items.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the dropdown is open, false otherwise.

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of every item.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The `<vaadin-combo-box-item>` internal container DOM element.
- `comboBox` The reference to the `<vaadin-combo-box>` element.
- `model` The object with the properties related with the rendered
  item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the rendered item.
  - `model.item` The item.

properties.name: items
properties.description:
A full set of items to filter the visible options from.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

properties.name: allowCustomValue
properties.description:
If `true`, the user can input a value that is not present in the items list.
`value` property will be set to the input value in this case.
Also, when `value` is set programmatically, the input value will be set
to reflect that value.

properties.name: filteredItems
properties.description:
A subset of items, filtered based on the user input. Filtered items
can be assigned directly to omit the internal filtering functionality.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The `String` value for the selected item of the combo box. Provides
the value for `iron-form`.

When there’s no item selected, the value is an empty string.

Use `selectedItem` property to get the raw selected item from
the `items` array.

properties.name: _lastCommittedValue
properties.description: Used to detect user value changes and fire `change` events.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: When set to `true`, "loading" attribute is added to host and the overlay element.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: Filtering string the user has typed into the input field.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description: The selected item from the `items` array.

properties.name: itemLabelPath
properties.description:
Path for label of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemLabelPath` is used to fetch the displayed string label for each
item.

The item label is also used for matching items when processing user
input, i.e., for filtering and selecting items.

When using item templates, the property is still needed because it is used
for filtering, and for displaying the selected item value in the input box.

properties.name: itemValuePath
properties.description:
Path for the value of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemValuePath:` is used to fetch the string value for the selected
item.

The item value is used in the `value` property of the combo box,
to provide the form value.

properties.name: itemIdPath
properties.description:
Path for the id of the item. If `items` is an array of objects,
the `itemIdPath` is used to compare and identify the same item
in `selectedItem` and `filteredItems` (items given by the
`dataProvider` callback).

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: Set to true if the value is invalid.

properties.name: theme
properties.description:
Helper property with theme attribute value facilitating propagation
in shadow DOM. Allows using `theme$="[[theme]]"` in the template.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label for this element.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Set to true to mark the input as required.

properties.name: preventInvalidInput
properties.description: Set to true to prevent the user from entering invalid input.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: A pattern to validate the `input` with.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: The error message to display when the input is invalid.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: A placeholder string in addition to the label.

properties.name: clearButtonVisible
properties.description: Set to true to display the clear icon which clears the input.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Moving the focus from the host element causes firing of the blur event what leads to problems in IE.

methods.name: blur
methods.description:
Native bluring in the host element does nothing because it does not have the focus.
In chrome it works, but not in FF.

methods.name: clearCache
methods.description: Clears the cached pages and reloads data from dataprovider when needed.

methods.name: render
methods.description: Manually invoke existing renderer.

methods.name: open
methods.description: Opens the dropdown list.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the dropdown list.

methods.name: _clear
methods.description: Clears the current value.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Reverts back to original value.

methods.name: _inputValueChanged
methods.description: Filtering and items handling

methods.name: _isValidValue
methods.description: Checks if the value is supported as an item value in this control.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Returns true if `value` is valid, and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately.

return.desc: True if the value is valid and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description:
Returns true if the current input value satisfies all constraints (if any)

You can override the `checkValidity` method for custom validations.

events.name: change

Fired when value changes.
To comply with https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/change

events.name: custom-value-set
events.description: Fired when the user sets a custom value.

elements.description:
`<vaadin-combo-box-light>` is a customizable version of the `<vaadin-combo-box>` providing
only the dropdown functionality and leaving the input field definition to the user.

The element has the same API as `<vaadin-combo-box>`.

To create a custom input field, you need to add a child element which has a two-way
data-bindable property representing the input value. The property name is expected
to be `value` by default. See the example below for a simplest possible example
using a `<vaadin-text-field>` element.

```html
<vaadin-combo-box-light>
  <vaadin-text-field>
  </vaadin-text-field>
</vaadin-combo-box-light>
```

If you are using other custom input fields like `<iron-input>`, you
need to define the name of the bindable property with the `attrForValue` attribute.

```html
<vaadin-combo-box-light attr-for-value="bind-value">
  <iron-input>
    <input>
  </iron-input>
</vaadin-combo-box-light>
```

In the next example you can see how to create a custom input field based
on a `<paper-input>` decorated with a custom `<iron-icon>` and
two `<paper-button>`s to act as the clear and toggle controls.

```html
<vaadin-combo-box-light>
  <paper-input label="Elements" class="input">
    <iron-icon icon="toll" slot="prefix"></iron-icon>
    <paper-button slot="suffix" class="clear-button">Clear</paper-button>
    <paper-button slot="suffix" class="toggle-button">Toggle</paper-button>
  </paper-input>
</vaadin-combo-box-light>
```

methods.description: Opens the dropdown list.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the dropdown list.

methods.name: _clear
methods.description: Clears the current value.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Reverts back to original value.

methods.name: _inputValueChanged
methods.description: Filtering and items handling

methods.name: _isValidValue
methods.description: Checks if the value is supported as an item value in this control.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Returns true if `value` is valid, and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately.

return.desc: True if the value is valid and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description:
Returns true if the current input value satisfies all constraints (if any)

You can override the `checkValidity` method for custom validations.

elements.name: Vaadin.ComboBoxLightElement

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description: Number of items fetched at a time from the dataprovider.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Total number of items.

attributes.name: data-provider
attributes.description:
Function that provides items lazily. Receives arguments `params`, `callback`

`params.page` Requested page index

`params.pageSize` Current page size

`params.filter` Currently applied filter

`callback(items, size)` Callback function with arguments:
  - `items` Current page of items
  - `size` Total number of items.

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description: True if the dropdown is open, false otherwise.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Set to true to disable this element.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: When present, it specifies that the element field is read-only.

attributes.name: renderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of every item.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The `<vaadin-combo-box-item>` internal container DOM element.
- `comboBox` The reference to the `<vaadin-combo-box>` element.
- `model` The object with the properties related with the rendered
  item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the rendered item.
  - `model.item` The item.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description:
A full set of items to filter the visible options from.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

attributes.name: allow-custom-value
attributes.description:
If `true`, the user can input a value that is not present in the items list.
`value` property will be set to the input value in this case.
Also, when `value` is set programmatically, the input value will be set
to reflect that value.

attributes.name: filtered-items
attributes.description:
A subset of items, filtered based on the user input. Filtered items
can be assigned directly to omit the internal filtering functionality.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The `String` value for the selected item of the combo box. Provides
the value for `iron-form`.

When there’s no item selected, the value is an empty string.

Use `selectedItem` property to get the raw selected item from
the `items` array.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: When set to `true`, "loading" attribute is added to host and the overlay element.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description: Filtering string the user has typed into the input field.

attributes.name: selected-item
attributes.description: The selected item from the `items` array.

attributes.name: item-label-path
attributes.description:
Path for label of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemLabelPath` is used to fetch the displayed string label for each
item.

The item label is also used for matching items when processing user
input, i.e., for filtering and selecting items.

When using item templates, the property is still needed because it is used
for filtering, and for displaying the selected item value in the input box.

attributes.name: item-value-path
attributes.description:
Path for the value of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemValuePath:` is used to fetch the string value for the selected
item.

The item value is used in the `value` property of the combo box,
to provide the form value.

attributes.name: item-id-path
attributes.description:
Path for the id of the item. If `items` is an array of objects,
the `itemIdPath` is used to compare and identify the same item
in `selectedItem` and `filteredItems` (items given by the
`dataProvider` callback).

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true if the value is invalid.

attributes.name: attr-for-value
attributes.description:
Name of the two-way data-bindable property representing the
value of the custom input field.

events.name: change
events.description:
Fired when value changes.
To comply with https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/change

events.name: custom-value-set
events.description: Fired when the user sets a custom value.

Also, when `value` is set programmatically, the input value will be set
to reflect that value.

properties.description:

can be assigned directly to omit the internal filtering functionality.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

properties.name: value

When there’s no item selected, the value is an empty string.

Use `selectedItem` property to get the raw selected item from
the `items` array.

properties.name: _lastCommittedValue
properties.description: Used to detect user value changes and fire `change` events.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: When set to `true`, "loading" attribute is added to host and the overlay element.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: Filtering string the user has typed into the input field.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description: The selected item from the `items` array.

properties.name: itemLabelPath
properties.description:
Path for label of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the

The item label is also used for matching items when processing user

When using item templates, the property is still needed because it is used

properties.name: itemValuePath
properties.description:
Path for the value of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemValuePath:` is used to fetch the string value for the selected
item.

The item value is used in the `value` property of the combo box,
to provide the form value.

properties.name: itemIdPath
properties.description:
Path for the id of the item. If `items` is an array of objects,
the `itemIdPath` is used to compare and identify the same item
in `selectedItem` and `filteredItems` (items given by the
`dataProvider` callback).

methods.name: clearCache
methods.description: Clears the cached pages and reloads data from dataprovider when needed.

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description: Number of items fetched at a time from the dataprovider.

attributes.description: Total number of items.

attributes.name: data-provider
attributes.description:
Function that provides items lazily. Receives arguments `params`, `callback`

`params.page` Requested page index

classes.description: Placeholder object class representing items being loaded.
classes.name: Vaadin.ComboBoxPlaceholder

properties.name: touchDevice
properties.description: True if the device supports touch events.

properties.name: positionTarget
properties.description: The element to position/align the dropdown by.

properties.name: renderer
properties.description: Custom function for rendering the content of the `<vaadin-combo-box-item>` propagated from the combo box element.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: `true` when new items are being loaded.

properties.name: theme
properties.description: Used to propagate the `theme` attribute from the host element.

methods.name: indexOfLabel
methods.description: Gets the index of the item with the provided label.

methods.name: __requestItemByIndex
methods.description:
If dataProvider is used, dispatch a request for the item’s index if
the item is a placeholder object.

methods.name: getItemLabel
methods.description: Gets the label string for the item based on the `_itemLabelPath`.

methods.name: _patchWheelOverScrolling
methods.description:
We want to prevent the kinetic scrolling energy from being transferred from the overlay contents over to the parent.
Further improvement ideas: after the contents have been scrolled to the top or bottom and scrolling has stopped, it could allow
scrolling the parent similarly to touch scrolling.
